meanings.definition: To measure the dimensions of an object with calipers.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter calipered the wood to ensure it was the right size.
meanings.sent2: She carefully calipered the metal rod to get an accurate measurement.
meanings.sent3: The curious cat calipered the toy mouse, trying to figure out its size.
meanings.sent4: His eyes calipered her every move, trying to understand her intentions.
meanings.sent5: The scientist calipered the specimen with precision, noting every detail.

meanings.definition: To mark or measure with calipers.
meanings.sent1: The artist calipered the canvas before starting to paint.
meanings.sent2: He calipered the paper to make sure the margins were even.
meanings.sent3: The chef calipered the dough, making sure each piece was the same size.
meanings.sent4: She calipered the fabric, preparing to cut it for the dress.
meanings.sent5: The teacher calipered the students' desks, ensuring they were spaced correctly.
